description: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has issued a request of proposal for occupational health services in division F and T
full_summary:
### **Tender Announcement: Physicians**

#### Competition ID: #M5000-24-1678/A

**Period of Provision of Services:**
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites proposals to provide occupational health services for RCMP members in 'F' & T divisions, Regina, Saskatchewan. Services are required for a period of one year, with an option to extend for up to two additional one-year periods.

**Scope of Work:**
RCMP requires up to 3 physicians to work approximately 20 hours per week each, or one physician working 40 hours per week and one physician working 20 hours per week. The contract period runs from the date of contract, with anticipated start dates of May 1st, 2024, and July 1st, 2024. Providers must ensure that the selected physicians meet the requirements outlined in the tender documents.

**Evaluation and Basis of Selection:**
Responsive bids that meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria will be declared eligible. The tender with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract. Tenders must be submitted electronically to NWR_Procurement_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca and must adhere to all specifications outlined in the tender documents.

**Key Documents:**
Attached to this tender notice are the following documents:
* Solicitation Amendment 1 (English)
* Solicitation Amendment 1 (French)
* Solicitation Amendment 2 (English)
* Solicitation Amendment 2 (French)
* Request for Proposal (RFP) Version 02 (English)
* Request for Proposal (RFP) Version 02 (French)

For more information regarding this opportunity, please refer to the attached tender documents.

#### Important Information

The procurement method employed by RCMP is subject to the Integrity Regime, administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. Therefore, integrity provisions are being applied to this procurement as outlined in the solicitation.

Government of Canada will make available required solicitations and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tenders-opportunities. Only registered bidders will have access to these materials.

Canada is committed to providing opportunities for Indigenous businesses. The Federal Indigenous Business Directory is an online resource for procuring Canadian government contracts. Registering an Indigenous business profile increases visibility and provides access to a database of Indigenous businesses. For more information, please visit www.canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory.  Canada requests that bidders adhere to all specifications
